posts.post_content:
I like this card.
  
I feel that is is the best black common in Zendikar
  
It has good artwork and is a great mid-game card.
  
The [Lacerator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lacerator) has it's place in the opening, but I wouldn't want four of those down without a [Child of Night](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Child of Night) or [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk) down, but I would want four Guul Draz Vampire's down, and that is the main thing in deck design I find, 'Do I really want four of these down at the same time?'
posts.html:
I like this card.
I feel that is is the best black common in Zendikar
It has good artwork and is a great mid-game card.
The Lacerator has it's place in the opening, but I wouldn't want four of those down without a Child of Night or Vampire Nighthawk down, but I would want four Guul Draz Vampire's down, and that is the main thing in deck design I find, 'Do I really want four of these down at the same time?'
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Spideredd (9/30/2009 6:23:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Not too bad.... kinda has its own pseudo Kicker! Players can only pay the kicker if they have the mana which is usually later in the game (usually) the card after kicker is almost always better :-) This card is kinda the same except for if she lives long enough she kicks herself (no pun intended!) And she gets obviously gets better than a 1/1. Problem with her is that it appears that there will be a lot of vamp decks in the meta game... which means her intimidation factor will pretty much stank. Overall a decent common, but definitely not one that's gonna drastically cheese up someones deck for sure

Rating:

posts.post_content: OK...[Vampire Lacerater](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Lacerater) is a better one drop for the early game, but 3/2 with a good evasion ability in the mid to late game, which leaves you mana to play removal, bigger creatures, or anything else with the 2-3 mana you save on her makes it worthy of at least PLAYTESTING a couple slots. A better top deck than Lacerater in the late game, full stop.

A better top deck than Lacerater in the late game, full stop.

Posted By: makochman (9/25/2009 3:52:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'd pick this over the Lacerater for the mid-late game value. I know a lot of people who have an odd obsession with turn one 2/2s, that end up being dead draws later. I'd rather have a 3/2 with new fear turn 4+ than a 2/2 at that point. Especially with pumping cards, this'll be good, seeing as -Oddly- there are fewer vampires with flying than I would have expected before Zendikar.  
  
Maybe a new best friend of Sorin and Vampire Nocturnas? The deck could work out awesomely, and if not, be fun.
posts.html:
I'd pick this over the Lacerater for the mid-late game value. I know a lot of people who have an odd obsession with turn one 2/2s, that end up being dead draws later. I'd rather have a 3/2 with new fear turn 4+ than a 2/2 at that point. Especially with pumping cards, this'll be good, seeing as -Oddly- there are fewer vampires with flying than I would have expected before Zendikar.

Maybe a new best friend of Sorin and Vampire Nocturnas? The deck could work out awesomely, and if not, be fun.

Posted By: True_Mumin (9/27/2009 3:20:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is a very good one-drop for limited. Obviously, above 10 life, it is worse than most one drops, being a 1/1. However, in limited, people often miss their one-drops, don't have any, etc, so it may be able to sneak in for some damage. However, unlike most other one-drops, this is not a terrible top-deck late game. If you hit it later on, you get a 3/2 fear for one, as opposed to say, a 2/2 with no evasion for 1.  
  
Obviously vampire lacerator is a better one-drop 1st turn, but it is a far worse top-deck late game. Both are strong cards in limited, but I don't expect this to make the jump to constructed, where the lacerator might.
posts.html:
This is a very good one-drop for limited. Obviously, above 10 life, it is worse than most one drops, being a 1/1. However, in limited, people often miss their one-drops, don't have any, etc, so it may be able to sneak in for some damage. However, unlike most other one-drops, this is not a terrible top-deck late game. If you hit it later on, you get a 3/2 fear for one, as opposed to say, a 2/2 with no evasion for 1.

Obviously vampire lacerator is a better one-drop 1st turn, but it is a far worse top-deck late game. Both are strong cards in limited, but I don't expect this to make the jump to constructed, where the lacerator might.

posts.post_content: The versatility of this card is nice. If you get it in your starting hand, it's nice to have a creature out on turn 1. If you get this late game (and you've played your cards right), you've got a nice 3/2. I think it'll find a home in any decent Vampire deck. I know it's finding one in mine.
